properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 3:35PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Duluth MN
properties.description:
...DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS THROUGH THURSDAY WITH ACCUMULATING SNOW
AND BLOWING SNOW ALONG THE SOUTH SHORE...

.Lake effect snow will impact the South Shore through Thursday
morning. Additional accumulations of between two and four inches
are forecast for northern Ashland and Iron counties. Two inches
or less of new snow are expected for the remainder of the South
Shore.

Dangerous wind chills are expected across northeast Minnesota and
northwest Wisconsin as arctic air spreads across the region
through Thursday morning. The coldest wind chills near 45 below
will occur from the International border through the Iron Range
and the Cass Lake and Hackensack areas. Wind chills of 25 to 35
below are expected for the remainder of northeast Minnesota and
northwest Wisconsin. Frost bite is possible in as little as 10
minutes.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow.
Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches, except 2 to
4 inches for northern Iron and Ashland counties. For the Wind
Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as
low as 30 below zero.

* WHERE...Douglas, Bayfield, Ashland and Iron Counties. This
includes the Tribal Lands of the Red Cliff Band and the Bad
River Reservation.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST
Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM to noon CST
Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed
skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or
511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST THURSDAY
